content.description: Sit start and climb the flake to the top.  Big holds all the way. Aka Sorry! in New England Bouldering
content.location: on the boulder to the right of the lilypad problem

content.description: Start standing underneath small bulge/roof. Climb up and over to top.  #1 on the beta photo.

Stat on the crimps as for dragon tails, instead of moving into the roof make a move with the left hand straight up to a down pulling crimp, throw your right foot high and out right and you can then lean our right through a series of left facing edges. From here span out to a good edge far out on the right face or you can track in with the left hand to one of the left facing edges, resettle your feet, and reach up to the lip, topping out the same as for Turtle Flakes.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, the landing isn't great as it is 2 tiered.
content.location: Same start as Dragon Tails, on the raised platform above and to the right of Lilypad/Prelude.

content.description: Start sitting below and slightly to the left of Lilly Pad. Akward climbing for several moves and then finish on Lilly Pad.    [Variation:]  start below and slightly right of Lilly Pad. Climb up and into Lilly Pad (V9) - This is probably the better line.

The best problem out of the bunch down here.. I'd give it more stars if it wasn't so sharp. Start with right hand on the thin crimp or slot at about head height and left hand on the undercling flake. Work up to the three finger pocket, top out straight up. #2 on the beta photo.
content.location: The most obvious line at the lilypad boulders.. climbs the bulge from a stand start

content.description: This is the invert offwidth climb located at the back of the small cave shared with Dragon Tails. Start as far back in the cave as you can, throw both feet up into the crack as deep as you can, and then start working left. The climb uses heel/toe cams to shuffle yourself left while tracking the hands along the edge of the boulder your stomach is pressed against. Offwidth shuffle left to a weird move to flip yourself around and finish with the same topout as Dragon Tails.
content.location: Left of Dragon Tails on the right of the two Lilypad boulders.

content.description: Start sitting just right of turtle head roof on face. Climb left using a crimp rail underneath roof. Make big move to lip of roof near the Lily Pad boulder then bearhug roof and climb to top of turtle head. Mantle head to topout. #4 on the beta photo

pathTokens: Warm Up Area aka The Tomato Overhangs / Mack'sTraverse

content.description: Down hill from Mack's Traverse, next to the small lilly pond is a clump of boulders. Looking at them from the pond, on the left is a tall, steep prow where The Lillypad problem is located, and to the right is the "turtle head". Secluded compared to the warm up cave, usually you won't find many climbers down here, but there are a few problems worth a visit.
